fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39797].
  {panel}

This jira describes two defects, and one usability improvement:

DEFECT 1:
When assigning a jira by the name of the assignee, you usually start typing the name of the assignee, and then select the assignee from the filtered list.

When a user needs to re-assign a huge number of jiras to the same person, it is cumbersome to type the name over and over. Its easier to use the filtered list the first time, then copy the full name as provided in the list, and paste it into the assignee field for all other jiras you want to assign to that same person.

The issue is that when you paste that full name into an assignee field, you are forced to re-select that person from the auto-complete field (which results in the same name being set anyway). If you remove focus from the assignee field after pasting in the full name, and without selecting the user from the filtered list, then the assignment fails with: "User '??????' does not exist." - even through it is the exact name of that user.

This happens in both the Assign Dialog, and the Assignee editable field (under people) on the jira page, however the error in the Assign dialog doesn't appear until you click the Assign button on the dialog.

Exact steps:
Locate any editable existing jira, which is currently assigned to a user (lets say "Bob Smith").
Edit the assignee field, and copy the exact full name (Bob Smith).
Delete the text in the assignee field.
Paste in the copied text (Bob Smith).
The filter will come up with the match for Bob Smith. Don't select this - just click outside of the text field (shift focus) to confirm your edit of Bob Smith.
Red error message is displayed underneath saying "User 'Bob Smith' does not exist."

I'm guessing that the actual assignee being set in the background is not the name of the user, but his email address or user Id, and to prevent accidental incorrect assignment in the case of two users having the exact same full name... however even in large organisations that is not a very likely occurrence. For usability sake, if the user makes an edit to the assignee field and the field loses focus, you could do and ajax check for an exact, distinct match on the supplied name, and if so - assign that user Id/email transparently in the background, otherwise (if no match or non-distinct match) display the usual error.
Once you remove focus from the field, there is an ajax request and a busy-spinner is displayed while waiting - in that request you could supply the entered text, and look for a distinct match on name...

DEFECT 2:
In the error scenario above, if you have pasted in the exact full name, shifted focus, and received the error message "User 'Bob Smith' does not exist.", and you attempt to fix it by opening the dropdown box on the assignee field (which is visible while the field is in edit mode) to reselect the user from the list; then the list opens, but filtering fails, and displays "No Matches", even though you have the exact full name of that user in the text edit field.
You are forced to once again delete the name form the field, and type it in again.

This happens in both the Assign Dialog, and the Assignee editable field (under people) on the jira page, however the error in the Assign dialog the "No Matched" on dropdown-click doesn't appear until after you've tried to click the Assign button on the dialog, and received the error message.

USABILITY:
While assigning jiras and typing in the assignee name, the list of filtered users with a partial match of the entered text is displayed, however this filtered list is very slow (we use an Atlassian hosted Jira). Surely you could keep a list of most used users in a cookie / local storage in the browser, and use that as fast filtering then assigning?

Also, if you don't use the filtered list, but just click the dropdown, a list of "Suggestions" are displayed. This list is not populated very well. The users I assign jiras to most ofter are not in this list... instead its got names in of users I've not interacted with for a very long time, or very infrequently. This list of suggested users should be populated by users you most frequently interact with. Possibly filtered by Jira project.


This is noted on our Atlassian hosted Jira: Atlassian JIRA (v6.1.7#6163-sha1:94d557d), but might affect newer versions also.
fields.summary: Assigning jira by name of assignee fails in this scenario

fields.description:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39777].
  {panel}

You are able to choose _Select List (cascading)_ as Statistic Type when configuring a gadget. However, the results will also be separated by the parent select list.
!piechart.png|thumbnail!
As can be seen from the screenshot, issues from parent 1 are displayed separately.

It would help if you can choose to display it based only parent select list (and not display the child list). Then it will be easier to see the difference between the parent select lists. 

The screenshot is of pie chart, but it should be applied to all gadgets.
fields.summary: Select only parent select list in JIRA Gadgets

fields.description:
Using object of Version and method setReleased(boolean released) has different impact than using VersionManager and its method releaseVersion(Version version, boolean release). 

It works only until another Version is added. I suppose you should deprecate setReleased() method or delete it from public API.
fields.summary: releaseVersion vs. setReleased()

fields.description:
When plugin code creates a cache in a clustered environment with replicateAsynchronously() setting, a NPE is thrown. Strangely through, the second call succeeds and the cache can be used.

The code:
{code}
      CacheSettings settings = new CacheSettingsBuilder().replicateAsynchronously().build();
      cacheManager.getCache(cacheID, new MyLoader(), settings);
{code}

If {{replicateAsynchronously()}} is removed, everything works on the first time too.

The exception:
{code}
Exception in thread "ItemTrackerMonitor" java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.terracotta.context.extractor.ObjectContextExtractor.extractInstanceAttribute(ObjectContextExtractor.java:57)
	at org.terracotta.context.extractor.ObjectContextExtractor.extract(ObjectContextExtractor.java:50)
	at org.terracotta.context.ContextManager.getOrCreateTreeNode(ContextManager.java:129)
	at org.terracotta.context.ContextManager.associate(ContextManager.java:114)
	at org.terracotta.context.ContextManager.access$000(ContextManager.java:39)
	at org.terracotta.context.ContextManager$1.withParent(ContextManager.java:64)
	at net.sf.ehcache.constructs.EhcacheDecoratorAdapter.<init>(EhcacheDecoratorAdapter.java:68)
	at net.sf.ehcache.constructs.blocking.BlockingCache.<init>(BlockingCache.java:93)
	at net.sf.ehcache.constructs.blocking.BlockingCache.<init>(BlockingCache.java:106)
	at net.sf.ehcache.constructs.blocking.SelfPopulatingCache.<init>(SelfPopulatingCache.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.EhCacheManager$3.get(EhCacheManager.java:142)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.EhCacheManager$3.get(EhCacheManager.java:136)
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.ManagedLocks$ManagedLockImpl.withLock(ManagedLocks.java:303)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.EhCacheManager.createComputingCache(EhCacheManager.java:135)
	at com.atlassian.cache.impl.AbstractCacheManager.getCache(AbstractCacheManager.java:179)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor79.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.hostcomponents.impl.DefaultComponentRegistrar$ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(DefaultComponentRegistrar.java:129)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy188.getCache(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor79.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.bridge.external.HostComponentFactoryBean$DynamicServiceInvocationHandler.invoke(HostComponentFactoryBean.java:154)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy188.getCache(Unknown Source)
	at com.almworks.jira.structure.services2g.itemtracker.AOBasedItemTracker$ProductionEnv.getCache(AOBasedItemTracker.java:746)
{code}
fields.summary: NPE when initializing cache-api cache with replicateAsynchronously() setting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39749].
  {panel}

The new button under "Issues" menu called "Import Issues from CSV":

!import_issues_csv.png!

calls the following page: https://DOMAIN.atlassian.net/secure/BulkCreateSetupPage!default.jspa?externalSystem=com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-plugin:bulkCreateCsv

And "External System Import" - "Import from Comma-separated values (CSV)" calls the following page: https://DOMAIN.atlassian.net/secure/admin/CsvSetupPage!default.jspa?externalSystem=com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-plugin:csvImporter

As a result, both imports work differently. Using the new link, you cannot map certain fields, for example, "Issue ID" and "Parent ID" - that are mandatory to import sub-tasks via CSV. Using the 'old' approach where only *administrators* have access to, those fields are available.

'Old' import link:
!issue_id.png!

!parent_id.png!

'New" import link:

!issue_new_menu.png!

!parent_new_menu.png!
fields.summary: "Import Issues from CSV" button doesn't work in the same way as "External System Import"
Limit the list of groups when editing an user
Workload Pie Chart breaks after upgrading to 1.2.6

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39745].
  {panel}

When the ‘resolution’ field is added to the ‘Edit’ screen of a project, it becomes impossible to edit the issue without resolving it too. When the screen is open, setting the resolution is required and if it was previously unset, it will be set.

Not choosing a resolution results in an error, since it is requires, as shown below:
!edit_issue_with_resolution.png!

Also, there is no ‘Unresolved’ option to choose (the ‘Please select…’ is an invalid option):
!edit_issue_with_resolution_menu.png!

*Steps to reproduce*
* Have a project
* Add the ‘Resolution’ field to the edit screen
* Create an issue
** The ‘Resolution’ must not be set
* Edit the issue
* Change any field apart from ‘resolution’
* It is not possible to change this field without setting the resolution

This breaks the ‘edit’ function, because editing any field requires solving the issue.

*Workaround* 
* Remove the resolution from this screen
fields.summary: Adding the ‘Resolution’ field to the edit screen forces it to be set on every issue change

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39744].
  {panel}

We have a one-way AppLink to another JIRA instance. We have different users and projects, and I am not an administrator of the other JIRA server.
When users create a link from an issue in my local JIRA to the other instance, they are offered the option to "Create reciprocal link". However, this will never work and is confusing to users.
If an Application Link is 'single ended', users should not be offered the choice to "Create reciprocal link". Could you please disable this option for a single-ended AppLink?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Users should not be offered to "Create reciprocal link" in JIRA via a single-ended AppLink
Upon deletion of a component, do not delete the associated value from the issues.
Ability to set JIRA Initial Memory when installing.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39725].
  {panel}

Hi,

Simple case scenario, We have multiple user groups in our organisation - typically 3 main Groups (External, Business & Technology)

Sometimes we have projects which have sensitive information on them, when this happens it would make sense to set the Issue level security to this:

Current Assignee, Reporter and Watchers

As an example: I send a request to HR for an Increase where my payslip is attached where the assignee in is someone in HR, but we need my Boss to be a watcher who can comment or approve. In this case the only people who should see this issue would be myself(Reporter), the HR assistant (Current Assignee) and my boss (Watcher). But the problem is that now multiple people have browse access on the Project and can also see my payslip - This makes for a failed HR Support Project?

Please advise?
fields.summary: Allow Watchers to be added/View to issues on a project without browse permission for the entire project
Ability to Bulk Edit Shared Dashboards and Filters.
Copy Paste of Image into comments of an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39718].
  {panel}

When a user is deactivated, he/she doesn't realize that the account is deactivated. (All that a deactivated user can do is to reset their password; However, they cannot access their account)
And so when they try to reset their password, they successfully get to do that.
Yet, they cannot login.

Instead, when a deactivated user tries to reset the password, Jira should prompt him/her saying that their account is currently deactivated.
So, they will know what the issue is. And there's no confusion.
fields.summary: Deactivated users are capable of updating their password, although they cannot access their account?
The JIRA Credits page still shows JIRA 6.0

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39716]. {panel} The CSS attributes that Connect populates in the xml descriptor for a web item in location "admin_plugins_menu/admin-helper-admin-section" don't end up in the created link. This is breaking Connect dialog functionality as it relies on the css class ap-dialog being present on the link. The connect issue is https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AC-1069 I reproduced this running locally with 6.4-OD-03-010. The developer reported the issue on 24/4/14 so the issue has likely been there for a while. Note this is the only location we have noticed this behaviour. Web items in the navigation bar work fine and I have observed that we pass the same descriptor xml to jira in both cases. The web item xml looks like {code} /plugins/servlet/ac/jira-kitchensink//ui/pagogenerales?project_id={project.id} ap-dialog ap-plugin-key-jira-kitchensink ap-module-key-jira-kitchensink__web-item-example {code} The generated link is {code} foo {code} In contrast when the web item location is the nav bar, the xml looks like {code} /plugins/servlet/ac/jira-kitchensink//ui/pagogenerales?project_id={project.id} ap-dialog ap-plugin-key-jira-kitchensink ap-module-key-jira-kitchensink__web-item-example-2 {code} The generated link looks like {code} foo {code}
fields.summary: web item css missing for location "admin_plugins_menu/admin-helper-admin-section"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39715].
  {panel}

The audit log for modifications in a custom field does show the ID for it. The image below shows the audit log for a custom field:
!custom_field_edit_audit_log.png!

This information is important, for example, when a problem happens to see what custom field caused it. 

As an example, when a post function uses a custom field that was removed, it may cause an error. If the ID of the custom field was logged, it would be possible to know which entry of the audit log refers to the deletion of the custom field, by checking the ID.
fields.summary: Add the custom field ID to audit log for changes in a custom field
watch users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39712].
  {panel}

Recently I updated my Gentoo Linux installation:
kernel: 3.14.14-gentoo
coreutils: 8.21 (runuser is from coreutils)

When I start JIRA with start-jira.sh, I get an error: {quote}runuser: Failure setting user credentials{quote}

So the latest coreutils has a broken 'runuser' or gentoo has problems with it.
Found reports about this that are from 2013 year https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/linux.gentoo.user/IthwD8PHtzQ

Ubuntu even does not have 'runuser' command. It has 'su' only

Please try to start JIRA with 'su' first, then with 'runuser' in start-jira.sh script
fields.summary: Try to start JIRA with 'su' command first

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39711].
  {panel}

First logged as JSP-202149.

Based on discussion there I am raising this as feedback to the designers...

The UI for search in v6.3 is confusing/annoying. The magnifying glass looks like a button, but clicking on it doesn't do anything.

This means that to actually start the search you *have* to press enter. You can't begin the search with a mouse anymore. Particularly annoying if you selected search text from the auto complete list (drop down). In this case the new UI is less efficient than the old one.

Required sequence
#      <click> in search box
#      [tap] [tap] [tap]
#       <click> on auto complete list - optional
#      <Enter>

Would be better to allow search to be started by <click> OR <Enter>
fields.summary: After upgrade to 6.3 the search UI is confusing/annoying

fields.description:
Cross-post AOD-7395, I am sorry about that :( I would have filed this as query rather than bug but that is not an available option.

Recently trying to access JIRA OnDemand REST API using basic authentication results in error code 401 - unauthorized. Tried anything possible (curl) as documented for example here https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+REST+API+Example+-+Query+issues

Even simple call to /rest/api/2/serverInfo fails.

However when logged in using browser, call to the same URL returns correct JSON:
{ "baseUrl": "https://base.url.com", "version": "6.4-OD-04-006", "versionNumbers": [ 6, 4, 0 ], "buildNumber": 64001, "buildDate": "2014-08-20T00:00:00.000-0500", "serverTime": "2014-08-27T00:55:05.782-0500", "scmInfo": "b1633a7e36a916f95ac968aafe0f8b849ce804e3", "serverTitle": "JIRA" }

Are there any changes in authorization? Does something need to be setup on server side?
fields.summary: 401 Unauthorized when trying to access JIRA OnDemand REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39708].
  {panel}

Steps to repro:

1. On an instance with a context path, e.g. /jira
2. View a version page, e.g. /jira/browse/TEST/fixforversion/10005
3. Log out in another tab
4. Attempt to switch between the tabs on the left panel
5. After logging back in, you are redirected to a broken link, with the context path doubling up: /jira/jira/browse/TEST/fixforversion/10005
fields.summary: JIRA with context path redirects to 404 after logging back in - project admin page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39700].
  {panel}

When trying to filter issues in basic search mode, selected values for some field (e.g user fields - reporter, assignee etc) that is being used in the search would be listed up to 10 items, after which a message like "x more option. Continue typing to refine further." as shown in the screenshot below:
!dropdown.PNG|thumbnail!
Users would prefer to be able to see the complete list of selected users while they are searching for other users, it's ok if the prompt showing there are more options, can be clicked to expand to show all currently selected values.

Please note that the request is not to display the full list of selectable values, this wont be feasible as the list may contain thousands of users maching the search string in assignee or reporter case for instance. Rather it's to be able to display full list of already selected users that match the search criteria and then the list of unselected should continue underneath.
fields.summary: When performing a basic search, Issue Navigator Fields Drop Down menu should display full list of selected options

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39698].
  {panel}

Hi there 

I have a question. I am developing a custom listener (class java extends AbstractIssueEventListener) to check some fields when editing an incident. 
Is it possible to do in the listener (onIssueEvent) to update the issue throw an exception to show an error message to the user?
Jira 6.0
Thanks.
fields.summary: Show error message thrown in listener

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39697].
  {panel}

When sharing an issue, users are able to add an optional note.

At the moment, this field does not support html format. The note will be displayed as plain text like the screenshot below
!shareissue.png|thumbnail!

This field should be able to support html format and display the note with the proper format.

This field also does not support Wiki Renderer. It would be best if it supports both html and Wiki Renderer
fields.summary: Share Issue > Note field should support html

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39696].
  {panel}

*Background*
* URLs entered as description for custom fields are automatically converted into clickable hyperlinks
* In addition, these description fields support wiki-markup (e.g. also to included clickable links)
* Entering a hyperlink in the description of a Component, however, simply renders as text

*Expected Outcome*
* Hyperlinks used in Components' description fields should automatically render into clickable links

*Steps to reproduce*
# Browse to your project
# Create a new component
# Enter a description text including a valid hyperlink
#* http://www.atlassian.com
# Switch to the "Component Summary Panel"
#* https://<JIRA-SERVER/current/browse/<PROJECT>/component/17100/?selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:component-summary-panel
# The text is rendered yet the hyperlink is *not* clickable

*Use Case*
For one of our clients, several component leads want to refer to their Confluence spaces where additional information and various resources related to their component is documented. It would be an improvement to the usability, if users could directly jump to the space by simply clicking on the hyper link. Currently, the URL must be copied and pasted into the browser's address field.
fields.summary: Description of Components should convert url text to clickable hyperlinks

Project A subtasks once Move Issues Project B subtasks

fields.description:
We're an agency with multiple clients on JIRA. Similar to JRA-7889, when any of our users search for issues and use the "assignee" or "reporter" dropdowns, they can see all other users of the systems which is effectively a full list of our clients.

This is a major security problem for us, as it exposes our whole client list, with their emails, to every user.

We need a way to select that people only see certain other people (their coworkers, and us).
fields.summary: "Assignee" and "reporter" pickers in issue search expose user data
Default Dashboards and user preferences by group
As a JIRA User, I'd like to browse 'All Projects' alphabetically, independently of category

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39673].
  {panel}

Sometimes, there are dependencies between projects or versions of JIRA (project A is dependent on project B, for example). However, this is currently not possible to create/view in JIRA.

It would be really useful if we can create such dependencies, and also be able to do the following :

* The dependencies between Projects / Versions will be listed or illustrated graphically (for easier viewing)
* There will be notifications when releasing versions i.e. "The version you're releasing is dependant on the following Unrelased version (list of unreleased versions and their corresponding projects) and the following Released versions (list of released versions and their corresponding projects".
fields.summary: Allow users to create/view dependencies between projects and versions
Do not email me when I update a cast that I am watching

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39664].
  {panel}

Gliffy JIRA Plugin 4.0.3 is ready for release in OnDemand: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.gliffy.integration.jira/versions#b462

Direct .OBR link: https://marketplace-cdn.atlassian.com/files/artifact/07a2ae8f-d1e8-4b2b-8b41-bfa433946781/gliffy-jira-plugin-4.0.3.obr

This issue supersedes the previous OnDemand release request (4.0.2), here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-39548

This release is pretty minor, but has a minor classloader fix that can prevent OSGi conflicts from occurring in some cases.
fields.summary: Gliffy JIRA Plugin 4.0.3 is ready for release in OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39663].
  {panel}

I am NOT talking about JIRA Service Desk. Which provides these features for Internal Users and seems almost deceptively geared towards them by using terms like "Customer Support Desk", "Customer Portal", and "Customer Knowledge Base", gives many people the impression of a External Support System such as Zendesk, Freshdesk, etc.

However, it seems we would have many hurdles to jump around to utilized it in and close form of this fashion.

We currently have a support team of about 75 agents, which handle 15-30k tickets a month.

They have very specific needs. Customer Login & Ticket History, Chat, Knowledgebase, Screensharing / Video cast / recording, Phone support, etc.

While a few of these can be solved via add-ons and expensive API development. The fundamental backend doesn't support this. Nor does licensing.

Our company is ready to switch off Zendesk. and I'm pushing for JIRA so our 200 employees could collaborate with support, dev, and all around product releases and customer reported bugs etc. But there are many deal breakers here.

Maybe I'm looking at it the wrong way, But as I understand it, We'd need a couple million user license to support this.

And yes I'm aware of mail handlers, etc.

Theres got to be another way?
fields.summary: JIRA as a Product Support Desk
When 'time format' on 'time tracking setting' is "hours", time will be displayed in a mix of hours-only and hours-and-minutes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39654].
  {panel}

From JIRA 7.0 we plan to stop providing XML exports of the complete JIRA documentation.

The documentation has grown very large and contains content drawn from a number of other spaces for features that are shared between products (for example user management, application links, the universal plugin manager and more). This has made for a poor experience for users accessing the documentation locally (from an export that has been imported into their Confluence instance). In addition, it provides a less-than-complete experience for our many customers that also use JIRA Agile, JIRA Service Desk, etc.

We will continue to provide PDF exports of the documentation for all major versions of JIRA.

If you have concerns or comments on this decision, please feel free to comment on this ticket.
fields.summary: Feedback on plans to stop providing XML exports of the JIRA documentation

  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Browse through your field configuration
# Set a custom field to hidden
# In your dashboard, add the "Pie Chart" gadget
# In the "Statistics" field of Pie Chart's configuration, search for the field you've hidden

h3. Current behaviour

The field can be used as the statistic for the pie chart gadget.

h3. Expected behaviour

Since the field is hidden for this field configuration, remove the field from the statistics option list.

JIRA - JIRA application link documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39639].
  {panel}

The out of the box names for the CLONE link type are "clones" / "is cloned by", which implies an ongoing relationship between the source issue and the clone.  It causes a lot of confusion with our new (and old) employees who make not unreasonable assumptions, such as workflow transitions on an issue are applied to any issues that clone it.

The normal use case for the clone functionality is to speed up the creation of an issue that is substantially similar to another issue and then only have to edit the fields that differ, and the relationship between the issues is about something that happened historically.  It's still useful to maintain the information for hunting down issues that were unreasonably duplicated.

I suggest that using past tense ("cloned" / "was cloned by") would be more appropriately descriptive.  I even find "clone" to be a misleading term for what it describes, and something like "templated" / "was templated from" might be even better.

It's not clear to me if administrators can even do this themselves.  (See JRA-13976 and JRA-11600)  In any event CLONES is clearly more difficult to change than the other link types and changing it yourself is not recommended.
fields.summary: Rename out-of-box link type "is cloned by" to past tense

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39638].
  {panel}

Given I'm administering JIRA 
When I create a screen configuration
Then the fields of the screen configuration should always appear to the end user (especially the required ones!)
So that the user doesn't have to figure out how to configure the fields or look for the validation errors because they submitted the form wrong.

This is not a good user experience.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39630].
  {panel}

It would be better if, when you take a bulk change action from an Agile Board, that completion of the bulk change action returns you to the Agile Board view.

Currently on completion of the bulk change you are returned to the issue navigator with the selected issues.

My particular use-case is:

- Go to 'Work mode' view of a Scrum board.
- Shift-select a list of issues, right-click, Bulk Change.
- Perform a bulk change (e.g. Transition Issues)
- On completion of bulk change, expected result is that user is return back to Scrum board, but instead, user is taken to filtered issue navigator
fields.summary: Bulk changing from board should return to board on completion

  {panel}

When trying to bulk edit more that 500 issues, a 'Page Unavailable' error is displayed.

Steps to reproduce:
# Run a query that will produce a large result set
# Select Bulk Edit from the drop down actions
# In the bulk edit mode, we...
## Select all issues - click next
## Choose the Edit Issues operation from the Bulk Edit screen - click next
Error screen appears after a minute or two delay.
fields.summary: Bulk edit issues should be a long-running task

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39609].
  {panel}

This release contains the work from [SHPXXVII-10|https://shipit.atlassian.net/browse/SHPXXVII-10].

We added a page in project admin, so that HipChat notifications are more discoverable.
* This looks for post functions that the project uses and displays them in a table
* Users can edit and delete existing HipChat post functions, but cannot create them here (that is a lot more work)

On the create/edit post function page:
* JQL autocomplete
* AJS.MultiSelect room picker (really useful if you have a lot of rooms)
* Custom messaging - this allows the user to type their own notification message, with some macros to render the issue icon, key, summary, etc.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39603].
  {panel}

A customer reported a problem where the wrong value was copied from a Select List (Cascating) in a parent issue to its subtask on creation. This happens when using the post function ‘Copy Value From Other Field’, available with the add-on ‘JIRA Suite Utilities’.

After investigation, I notice that the problem only occurred if different parent options had the same child option values in the Select List custom field. For example:
* Value 1
** Value A
* Value 2
** Value A
** Value B

If the parent issue holds the values (Value 2, Value A), since ‘Value A’ is also present in ‘Value 1’, the value copied is actually (Value 1, Value A), which is not the expected behaviour. It seems that it only takes account of the child options to choose the value. 

If we choose the second parent option created in the list, it actually chooses the first one, though it is unclear if its chosen by order.

*Steps to reproduce*
* Install and enable ‘JIRA Suite Utilities’ add-on
* Create a ‘Select List (Cascating)’ custom field
* Add 2 options (e.g. Value 1 and Value 2) and, within each one, one child option with the same name in both (e.g Value A)
** Pretty much like the example above (no need for Value B)
* Create a project with Subtasks
* Create a specific workflow for the subtasks
* Add a ‘Copy Value From Other Field’ post function to the ‘Create Issue’ transition in this workflow
** Select the created custom field for both source and destination
** Select the option ‘Copy from parent’ option
* Create an issue in the project with the second parent option and equivalent sub-option (e.g. Value 2, Value A)
* Create a Subtask for this task
* Its value for the field will be the first one (Value 1, Valeu A), when it should be the second (i.e. a simple copy).

*Workarounds*
No workaround available.
fields.summary: Copying value from Parent to Subtask on Create Issue Post Function Copies Wrong Value For Select List (Cascating) Custom Field
REST API should allow assignee to be specified by email address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39598].
  {panel}

Currently, while in the log work screen or the resolve issue screen or the close issue screen, the 'Remaining Estimate' field provides four options via radio buttons. 

These are:
Adjust automatically
Leave estimate unset
Set to.....
Reduce by....

We should be able to customized these based on what may be applicable for our project and make available them available and either suppress display of the other options or at the least grey others out.

Thanks!

Ravi Kanduri
